title: In SQL, when using an aggregate function with the 'having' clause, does that function has to be in the select statement?
body:
No. You can use different aggregate function in HAVING Clause . It is not depending on the SELECT Clause

Example:

SELECT column_name, SUM(column_name)
FROM table_name
WHERE column_name IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY column_name
HAVING COUNT(column_name) > 1;

This is also valid:

SELECT column_name_1, SUM(column_name_2)
FROM table_name
WHERE column_name_3 IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY column_name_1
HAVING COUNT(column_name_4) > 1;
